meta: The sound represented as ã is a "nasalized" vowel. It is pronounced like the "a" in "father," but with the air passing through the nose, as in the French word "ban."
train:
Ofi'at kowi'ã lhiyohli. -> The dog chases the cat.
Kowi'at ofi'ã lhiyohli. -> The cat chases the dog.
Ofi'at shoha. -> The dog stinks.
Ihooat hattakã hollo. -> The woman loves the man.
Lhiyohlili. -> I chase (him/her).
Salhiyohli. -> (He/She) chases me.
Hilha. -> (He/She) dances.
